result.execSummary:
The defendant Martin Dwayne Triplett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin(>50g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense, Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)4.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court costs, victim witness surcharge, DNA surcharge.  To be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds. Balance to be paid prior to Extended supervision period.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.  Any bail to apply.
**Restitution set at zero.

*9/21/2021  Honorable Carolina Maria Stark signed Decision and Order.  Amended to include five days of sentence credit.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.  Absolute sobriety. Random urine screens ad breathalyzers.
Only possess one telephone and one telephone number at any time.

No alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription.
No possession nor use of any drug paraphernalia..
No contact with Anthony B., Patricia R., or Dwight C. pursuant to ss973.049.
No contact with any known gang member.
No contact with 4668 N. 29 Street, Milwaukee, WI.
No living or working where any weapons are used or stored.
No more than $200.00 on person at one time.
No possession  of any firearms or firearm supplies at anytime, ever.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample, pay related surcharge.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

Defendant's pro se motion for sentence modification. (Martin D. Triplett #272977, MCC, 8500 Rainbow Rd., Lake Tomahawk, WI  54539).

Per order dated February 13, 2020, Appeal No. 2017AP1724-CR, IT IS ORDERED that the motion is granted.  Mr. Triplett shall have until March 8, 2020, to serve and file a supplemental petition in support of review.  If the supplemental petition is not filed by that time, this matter will be disposed of based solely on the no-merit petition for review filed by Attorney Szabrowicz.
Letter to Defendant from the Supreme Court regarding statement of reasons in support of Petition for Review, received.

Per order dated January 14, 2020, Appeal No. 2017AP1724-CR, IT IS ORDERED that the judgment and postconviction order are summarily affirmed.  See WIS. STAT. RULE 809.21.  IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that this summary disposition order will not be published.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Martin Dwayne Triplett in court with attorney Edward Lee Wright.  Laura A. Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk:  ss

Defendants motion to withdraw guilty plea remains denied by the court.

  Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant. 
:
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 10 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 7 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, credit for zero days.

Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Restitution set at zero
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid prior to extended supervision period; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.  Any cash bail on deposit is to be applied
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge  to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid priorto the extended supervision period; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription
-Employment or school
-No possession nor use of any drug paraphinia
-No contact with Anthony B., Patricia R., or Dwight C. pursuant to ss973.049
-No contact with any known gang members
-No contact with 4668 N 29th Street  Milwaukee, WI
-No living or working where any weapons are used or stored
-No more than $200.00 on person at one time
-Only possess 1 telephone and 1 telephone number at any time
No possession of any firearms or firearm supplies at any time - ever
-No possession nor use of any controlled substances without a valid prescription
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he/she may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he/she may not vote in any election until his/her civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement

Defendant Martin Dwayne Triplett in court with attorney Edward Lee Wright.  Laura Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defense informs the court that defendant wishes to withdraw his plea.   Defense counsel also moves to withdraw as counsel.  No objection from the state.  Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court.  Court ordered defendant to immediatly report to the Public Defendar's Office to be evaluated and to return back to court this morning. 

LATER SAME MORNING.  
Defendant Martin Dwayne Triplett in court.  Paul Hauer for Laura Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant does qualify for Public Defendar representation.  Court ordered case adjourned for Status of Counsel in Branch 17.  Status conference scheduled for October 9, 2014 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Martin Dwayne Triplett in court with attorney Edward Lee Wright.  Laura A. Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case was set for final pre-trial.
Defendant sworn. Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.   All parties are notified that effective 8-03-14 this case will be assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17, in Room 313 of the Safety Building. Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26. July 30, 2014 at 9:00 a.m. jury trial vacated.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 22, 2014 at 08:30 am.
